events.description: US stocks sold off on Wednesday, led by significant declines in the technology sector.
AMD provided a disappointing outlook, causing a sharp decline in its stock price and the broader semiconductor sector.
The ADP report for January showed a significant slowdown in private payroll growth.

facts.fact_text: The S&P 500 decreased by approximately 1% and the Nasdaq fell by 2.3% on Wednesday.

evidences.evidence_text: the S&P 500 down about 1%, the Nasdaq sliding 2.3%

facts.fact_text: AMD shares dropped nearly 17% following a disappointing financial outlook.

evidences.evidence_text: AMD plunged nearly 17% on a disappointing outlook

facts.fact_text: Private payroll growth in January was 22,000 according to the ADP report.

evidences.evidence_text: the ADP report showed private payroll growth slowed to just 22K in January

facts.fact_text: Amgen shares rose over 7% due to strong earnings results.

evidences.evidence_text: Amgen surged over 7% on strong earnings

claims.claim_text: The market decline was driven by technology stocks amid fears of AI disruption and weak guidance.

evidences.evidence_text: technology led a broad risk-off move tied to renewed AI disruption fears and weak guidance

claims.claim_text: Automation might reduce pricing power and profit margins for software companies.
claims.author: investors

evidences.evidence_text: raising concerns that automation could erode pricing power and margins across enterprise, legal, and financial software

claims.claim_text: The ADP report indicates that labor demand is cooling.

evidences.evidence_text: reinforcing signs of cooling labor demand and offering little support for equities

evidence.evidence_text: technology led a broad risk-off move tied to renewed AI disruption fears
the ADP report showed private payroll growth slowed to just 22K in January, reinforcing signs of cooling labor demand
The decline was driven by semiconductors after AMD plunged nearly 17% on a disappointing outlook
raising concerns that automation could erode pricing power and margins
